channel.title: God makes apperance
channel.description: What would you do if you had all the money?

item.title: God makes apperance
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:20, topic:354703”]Good list, even if not complete for the discussion:

en.wikipedia.org

List of countries by public debt

This is a list of countries by public debt to GDP ratio as listed by CIA's World Factbook and IMF. Net debt figure is the cumulative total of all government borrowings less repayments that are denominated in a country's home currency. Gross government debt is the most relevant data for discussions of government default and debt ceilings. It is different from external debt, which includes the foreign currency liabilities of non-government entities.

It is based off the CIA factbook, but compiled against national GDP. We’re not all that bad, in regards to economy and spending power - the best comparisons are usually against France and Germany.[/quote]
It only shows the dept, not how much money they own or how much other countries owe them.
Many of the countries on that list have positive balance.

Read full topic

item.title: God makes apperance
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Good list, even if not complete for the discussion:

en.wikipedia.org

List of countries by public debt

This is a list of countries by public debt to GDP ratio as listed by CIA's World Factbook and IMF. Net debt figure is the cumulative total of all government borrowings less repayments that are denominated in a country's home currency. Gross government debt is the most relevant data for discussions of government default and debt ceilings. It is different from external debt, which includes the foreign currency liabilities of non-government entities.

It is based off the CIA factbook, but compiled against national GDP. We’re not all that bad, in regards to economy and spending power - the best comparisons are usually against France and Germany.

Read full topic

item.title: God makes apperance
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:18, topic:354703”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=451275.msg3317274#msg3317274 date=1282410523]
Gotta disagree on this one, money is an illusion. At this exact point in time right now every government owes money to ???.
[/quote]
Dept is a bad way to see how much money a country have.
https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/rankorder/2187rank.html
According to that, USA is the poorest nation in the world.[/quote]

Well obviously it changes if you look at it from different perspectives. Mine was based around GDP whereas that is just purely account balances.

Read full topic

item.title: God makes apperance
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:5, topic:354703”]Without money or any form of currency the world would fall apart.

based on weight in gold or silver or some other type of valuable metal.

not anymore[/quote]

Actually the use of “money” or currency can easily be argued as a stupid idea. Personally I think it’s an outdated method of trading. We should have moved on from it, and current the current governing set up long ago.

Also, afaik money is still valued against gold, if it was valued against nothing then it would be truly worthless.

Ollie:

its not a fucking illusion

Gotta disagree on this one, money is an illusion. At this exact point in time right now every government owes money to ???. This money doesn’t exist it’s a number (a very large negative number) on a computer somewhere.

The UK owes hundreds of billions, the US owes trillions. If you factor out public debt the UK is actually the most fucked. (http://www.economist.com/blogs/buttonwood/2010/06/indebtedness_after_financial_crisis // http://www.usdebtclock.org/)

The fact remains none of this “debt” really exists to you or me, it truly is an illusion. We’re not running out of any resources (yet) and the whole world is on the verge of collapsing down an economic depression that doesn’t really exist.

Now I can cite the venus project, etc. Someone will shout “NWO” or “CULT” at me, and then I’ll kindly remind you if this project had existed since the dawn of time (so, obviously it’s too late (on our planet) to implement such a thing now) greed wouldn’t exist (Greed is arguably learned rather than genetic) and the world would all be fine. HURRAH.

If we were all focused on scientific advancement (the world united) we’d be able to colonise space in no time ( a few centuries) and avoid our impending death. (http://bigthink.com/ideas/21570)

Read full topic

Time to go get rich.

item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:6, topic:354703”]Then the object of money is an illusion that has nothing backing it. O.O

Time to go get rich.[/quote]money isn’t an illusion, it’s designed to be representative of the goods and services you have provided to the world. this concept is generally respected by the world, so they provide you with their goods and services in exchange for your money. obviously if people disregarded this idea for whatever reason then money would have no value, but why would that happen?
